reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the application collects Personal Data from its Users.
reply.reference: This Application collects some Personal Data from its Users. URL: https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/78522884

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects device information, Usage Data, Application opens, User ID, purchase history, diagnostics, and product interaction.

reply.analysis: The types of data collected by the app are explicitly listed in the privacy policy document under the section 'Among the types of Personal Data that this Application collects.'
reply.reference: Personal Data: device information; Usage Data; Application opens; User ID; purchase history; diagnostics; product interaction. URL: https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/78522884

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: No specific declaration of the purpose of data collection and use is provided in the privacy policy.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy does not explicitly state the purposes for which data is collected and used, leading to the conclusion that the app does not declare the purpose of data collection and use.
reply.reference: No specific declaration of the purpose of data collection and use is provided in the privacy policy. URL: https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/78522884

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, users can opt out of data collection for direct marketing purposes. They can object to the processing for direct marketing purposes at any time, free of charge, and without providing any justification. This will result in the Personal Data no longer being processed for such purposes.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that users have the right to object to the processing of their Personal Data for direct marketing purposes, free of charge and without providing justification, thereby allowing them to opt out of data collection for such purposes.
reply.reference: Where the User objects to processing for direct marketing purposes, the Personal Data will no longer be processed for such purposes. To learn whether the Owner is processing Personal Data for direct marketing purposes, Users may refer to the relevant sections of this document. URL: https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/78522884

source_documents.excerpt:
obliged to retain Personal Data for a longer period whenever required to fulfil a legal obligation or upon order of an authority.
Once the retention period expires, Personal Data shall be deleted. Therefore, the right of access, the right to erasure, the right to rectification and the right to data portability cannot be enforced after expiration of the retention period.
Users may exercise certain rights regarding their Data processed by the Owner.

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly mentions that users are responsible for any third-party Personal Data obtained, published, or shared through this Application, indicating that data is indeed shared with third parties.
reply.reference: Users are responsible for any third-party Personal Data obtained, published or shared through this Application. URL: https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/78522884

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with third parties such as third-party technical service providers, mail carriers, hosting providers, IT companies, and communications agencies.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions that the app may share data with certain types of persons in charge, including external parties, who may act as Data Processors. These third parties are essential for the operation of the application in various aspects.
reply.reference: third parties (such as third-party technical service providers, mail carriers, hosting providers, IT companies, communications agencies) appointed, if necessary, as Data Processors by the Owner.
